group_1.textRight: The breeze feels nice~

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...
But it's not really making me feel any better...

group_1.textRight: Same here...
I still can't get over that night...
Even knowing witches used to be Magical Girls, @I don't hesitate to slay them,
but despite that, I'll never get used to fighting @against fellow Magical Girls.

group_1.textLeft: We have to shut out our emotions...

group_1.textRight: That's what Ao had done.

group_1.textLeft: She's a pure girl, so she's probably feeling even @worse than we are...
... Are the other Janomiya girls doing alright?

group_1.textRight: Yes.
Ao convinced them to trust in us.
Plus, the Janomiya girls who had infiltrated Torayamachi helped to convince them as well.
They'd spent so much time with us, after all.

group_1.textLeft: But Ao still hasn't shown herself...

group_1.textRight: I'm sure she's up to something right now.

group_1.textLeft: If you run into her somewhere,
tell her we're waiting for her to join us.

group_1.textRight: Right!
Now all that's left is dealing with Ryuugasaki.

group_1.textLeft: With so many of them hurt, they've certainly lost @faith in Juri.
So we should be able to convince them to join up @with us instead...

group_1.textRight: I don't think it's going to be that easy...

group_1.textLeft: If we hadn't been there, some of them would've @turned into witches...
They owe us for the Grief Seeds we gave them.
What's next is to give them a sense of security.

group_1.textRight: A sense of security?

group_1.textLeft: By now they should all understand that witches have returned to the city.
But since itâ€™s been so long, they're afraid they'll @vanish again.
You probably can't relate to that since you've been @with me this whole time.

group_1.textRight: But there's no way of making them feel safe other @than finding more witches...

group_1.textLeft: There's a way.
If we find out what caused witches to vanish in the @first place,
we can prepare for whatever happens next.

group_1.textRight: What if the cause is something that's out of @our hands?

group_1.textLeft: If that happens, we'll have to change our plans...

group_1.textRight: Sounds like a big gamble.

group_1.textLeft: It's better than not knowing the truth.

group_1.textRight: Ah Yuna, the meeting's about to start.

group_1.textLeft: We should head back, then...

group_1.narration: What about Juri, by the way? @We haven't heard from her since that night.
Just leave her alone. @She'll probably come back to try to fight me @even if she's the last one left in Ryuugasaki.

group_1.textRight: Yuna!

group_1.textLeft: Sakuya, what's going on?

group_1.textRight: You know that girl we sent chasing a witch?
We might have found her!

group_1.textLeft: What did you say...!?
So, where is she...?

group_1.textRight: I don't have the details, but somebody says she saw her...!

group_1.textLeft: (Is that really reliable information...?)
(And can I really afford to have Sakuya away while @we're still recovering...)

select.textSelect: Have Sakuya look into the missing Magical Girl

group_2.textLeft: (But if we find her, what she knows might help us to convince Ryuugasaki to join us...)
Will you look into this for me?

group_2.textRight: Sure, that was my plan anyway.

group_3.textLeft: (And can I really afford to have Sakuya away while @we're still recovering...)
Lets wait a little longer @for now give up....

select.textSelect: Have Sakuya look into the missing Magical Girl
